mlflex
Class ContinuousDependentVariableThresholdFinder

java.lang.Object
  mlflex.ContinuousDependentVariableThresholdFinder

public class ContinuousDependentVariableThresholdFinder
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains the logic necessary to empirically determine the "optimal" cutoff for converting a continuous dependent variable to a discrete dependent variable. This method uses the internal cross-validation folds to determine this value.

Author:
Stephen Piccolo

Nested Class Summary
static class ContinuousDependentVariableThresholdFinder.Metric
          This enum supports specification of any of a number of metrics to be used in determining the optimal threshold.

ContinuousDependentVariableThresholdFinder

public ContinuousDependentVariableThresholdFinder(AbstractDataProcessor processor,
                                                  ClassificationAlgorithm classificationAlgorithm,
                                                  ContinuousDependentVariableThresholdFinder.Metric metric,
                                                  boolean performHillClimbing,
                                                  java.lang.String survivalTransformedDataPointName,
                                                  java.lang.String lowDescriptor,
                                                  java.lang.String highDescriptor)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
Constructor

Parameters:
processor - Data processor containing the data that will be used for classification
classificationAlgorithm - Classification algorithm
metric - Metric that will be used to assess performance at each threshold
performHillClimbing - Whether to perform hill climbining
survivalTransformedDataPointName - Data point name for the transformed survival values
lowDescriptor - Descriptor used to indicate values that were below a given threshold
highDescriptor - Descriptor used to indicate values that were above a given threshold
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
Method Detail

DiscretizeSurvival

public java.lang.String DiscretizeSurvival(int outerFold,
                                           java.lang.String rawSurvival)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
This pass-through method performs the work of discretizing a raw dependent-variable value based on the selected threshold associated with the given outer cross-validation fold.

Parameters:
outerFold - Number of outer cross-validation fold
rawSurvival - Raw survival value
Returns:
Discretized survival value
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

GetBestThreshold

public double GetBestThreshold(int outerFold)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
This method indicates the "optimal" threshold for a given outer cross-validation fold.

Parameters:
outerFold - Number of outer cross-validation fold
Returns:
Selected threshold
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

Save

public void Save(int outerFold)
          throws java.lang.Exception
This method saves the threshold results for a given cross-validation fold. It contains logic to share the work across multiple computing nodes.

Parameters:
outerFold - Number of outer cross-validation fold.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

SelectThresholds

public void SelectThresholds()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
This method orchestrates the processor of selecting the "optimal" threshold for each outer cross-validation fold.
